//EL DICCIONARIO LE√çDO:

Palabra: a
Definiciones: the 1st letter of the Roman alphabet
(biochemistry) purine base found in DNA and RNA pairs with thymine in DNA and with uracil in RNA
the basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites "a typical household circuit carries 15 to 50 amps"
a metric unit of length equal to one ten billionth of a meter (or 0.0001 micron) used to specify wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation
any of several fat-soluble vitamins essential for normal vision prevents night blindness or inflammation or dryness of the eyes
one of the four nucleotides used in building DNA all four nucleotides have a common phosphate group and a sugar (ribose)
the blood group whose red cells carry the A antigen

Palabra: aachen
Definiciones: a city in western Germany near the Dutch and Belgian borders formerly it was Charlemagne's northern capital

Palabra: aaron
Definiciones: (Old Testament) elder brother of Moses and first high priest of the Israelites created the golden calf
United States professional baseball player who hit more home runs than Babe Ruth (born in 1934)

Palabra: abel
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Cain and Abel were the first children of Adam and Eve born after the Fall of Man Abel was killed by Cain
Norwegian mathematician (1802-1829)

Palabra: abelard
Definiciones: French philosopher and theologian lover of Heloise (1079-1142)

Palabra: aberdeen
Definiciones: a town in western Washington
a city in northeastern Scotland on the North Sea

Palabra: abidjan
Definiciones: city recognized by the United States as the capital of the Ivory Coast largest city of the Ivory Coast

Palabra: abilene
Definiciones: a town in central Kansas to the west of Topeka home of Dwight D. Eisenhower
a city in central Texas

Palabra: abraham
Definiciones: the first of the Old Testament patriarchs and the father of Isaac according to Genesis, God promised to give Abraham's family (the Hebrews) the land of Canaan (the Promised Land) God tested Abraham by asking him to sacrifice his son "Judaism, Christianity, and Islam each has a special claim on Abraham"

Palabra: abuja
Definiciones: capital of Nigeria in the center of the country

Palabra: abyssinia
Definiciones: Ethiopia is a republic in northeastern Africa on the Red Sea formerly called Abyssinia

Palabra: abyssinian
Definiciones: a small slender short-haired breed of African origin having brownish fur with a reddish undercoat

Palabra: ac
Definiciones: an electric current that reverses direction sinusoidally "In the US most household current is AC at 60 cycles per second"
a radioactive element of the actguernseyinide series found in uranium ores

Palabra: acadia
Definiciones: the French-speaking part of the Canadian Maritime Provinces

Palabra: acapulco
Definiciones: a port and fashionable resort city on the Pacific coast of southern Mexico known for beaches and water sports (including cliff diving)

Palabra: accra
Definiciones: the capital and largest city of Ghana with a deep-water port

Palabra: achaean
Definiciones: a member of one of four linguistic divisions of the prehistoric Greeks
the ancient Greek inhabitants of Achaea

Palabra: acheson
Definiciones: United States statesman who promoted the Marshall Plan and helped establish NATO (1893-1971)

Palabra: achilles
Definiciones: a mythical Greek hero of the Iliad a foremost Greek warrior at the siege of Troy when he was a baby his mother tried to make him immortal by bathing him in a magical river but the heel by which she held him remained vulnerable--his `Achilles' heel'

Palabra: aconcagua
Definiciones: the highest mountain in the western hemisphere located in the Andes in western Argentina (22,834 feet high)

Palabra: acropolis
Definiciones: the citadel in ancient Greek towns

Palabra: acts
Definiciones: a New Testament book describing the development of the early church from Christ's Ascension to Paul's sojourn at Rome

Palabra: ada
Definiciones: an enzyme found in mammals that can catalyze the deamination of adenosine into inosine and ammonia "ADA deficiency can lead to one form of severe combined immunodeficiency disease" "the gene encoding ADA was one of the earlier human genes to be isolated and cloned for study"

Palabra: adam
Definiciones: (Old Testament) in Judeo-Christian mythology the first man and the husband of Eve and the progenitor of the human race
street names for methylenedioxymethamphetamine
Scottish architect who designed many public buildings in England and Scotland (1728-1792)

Palabra: adams
Definiciones: a mountain peak in southwestern Washington in the Cascade Range (12,307 feet high)
2nd President of the United States (1735-1826)
6th President of the United States son of John Adams (1767-1848)
American Revolutionary leader and patriot an organizer of the Boston Tea Party and signer of the Declaration of Independence (1722-1803)

Palabra: adana
Definiciones: a city in southern Turkey on the Seyhan River

Palabra: adar
Definiciones: the sixth month of the civil year the twelfth month of the ecclesiastic year in the Jewish calendar (in February and March)

Palabra: adelaide
Definiciones: the state capital of South Australia

Palabra: aden
Definiciones: an important port of Yemen located on the Gulf of Aden its strategic location has made it a major trading center of southern Arabia since ancient times

Palabra: adenauer
Definiciones: German statesman chancellor of West Germany (1876-1967)

Palabra: adirondacks
Definiciones: a mountain range in northeastern New York State a popular resort area

Palabra: adonis
Definiciones: any handsome young man
(Greek mythology) a handsome youth loved by both Aphrodite and Persephone "when Adonis died Zeus decreed that he should spend winters in the underworld with Persephone and spend summers with Aphrodite"
annual or perennial herbs

Palabra: adrian
Definiciones: Roman Emperor who was the adoptive son of Trajan travelled throughout his empire to strengthen its frontiers and encourage learning and architecture on a visit to Britain in 122 he ordered the construction of Hadrian's Wall (76-138)
English physiologist who conducted research into the function of neurons 1st baron of Cambridge (1889-1997)

Palabra: adriatic
Definiciones: an arm of the Mediterranean between Slovenia and Croatia and Montenegro and Albania on the east and Italy on the west

Palabra: advent
Definiciones: the season including the four Sundays preceding Christmas
arrival that has been awaited (especially of something momentous) "the advent of the computer"
(Christian theology) the reappearance of Jesus as judge for the Last Judgment

Palabra: adventist
Definiciones: a member of Christian denomination that expects the imminent advent of Christ

Palabra: advil
Definiciones: a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory and analgesic medicine (trade names Advil and Motrin and Nuprin) used to relieve the pain of arthritis and as an antipyretic "daily use of ibuprofen can irritate the stomach"

Palabra: aegean
Definiciones: an arm of the Mediterranean between Greece and Turkey a main trade route for the ancient civilizations of Crete and Greece and Rome and Persia

Palabra: aeneas
Definiciones: a mythical Greek warrior who was a leader on the Trojan side of the Trojan War hero of the Aeneid

Palabra: aeneid
Definiciones: an epic in Latin by Virgil tells the adventures of Aeneas after the Trojan War provides an illustrious historical background for the Roman Empire

Palabra: aeolus
Definiciones: god of the winds in ancient mythology

Palabra: aeschylus
Definiciones: Greek tragedian the father of Greek tragic drama (525-456 BC)

Palabra: aesculapius
Definiciones: son of Apollo a hero and the Roman god of medicine and healing his daughters were Hygeia and Panacea

Palabra: aesop
Definiciones: Greek author of fables (circa 620-560 BC)

Palabra: afghan
Definiciones: a blanket knitted or crocheted in strips or squares sometimes used as a shawl
tall graceful breed of hound with a long silky coat native to the Near East
an Iranian language spoken in Afghanistan and Pakistan the official language of Afghanistan
a coat made of sheepskin
a native or inhabitant of Afghanistan

Palabra: afghanistan
Definiciones: a mountainous landlocked country in central Asia bordered by Iran to the west and Russia to the north and Pakistan to the east and south "Soviet troops invaded Afghanistan in 1979"

Palabra: africa
Definiciones: the second largest continent located to the south of Europe and bordered to the west by the South Atlantic and to the east by the Indian Ocean

Palabra: african
Definiciones: a native or inhabitant of Africa

Palabra: afrikaans
Definiciones: an official language of the Republic of South Africa closely related to Dutch and Flemish

Palabra: afrikaner
Definiciones: a white native of Cape Province who is a descendant of Dutch settlers and who speaks Afrikaans

Palabra: afro
Definiciones: a rounded thickly curled hairdo

Palabra: ag
Definiciones: a soft white precious univalent metallic element having the highest electrical and thermal conductivity of any metal occurs in argentite and in free form used in coins and jewelry and tableware and photography

Palabra: agamemnon
Definiciones: (Greek mythology) the king who lead the Greeks against Troy in the Trojan War

Palabra: agassiz
Definiciones: United States naturalist (born in Switzerland) who studied fossil fish recognized geological evidence that ice ages had occurred in North America (1807-1873)

Palabra: aglaia
Definiciones: (Greek mythology) one of the three Graces

Palabra: agni
Definiciones: (Sanskrit) Hindu god of fire in ancient and traditional India one of the three chief deities of the Vedas

Palabra: agra
Definiciones: a city in northern India former capital of the Mogul empire site of the Taj Mahal

Palabra: agricola
Definiciones: Roman general who was governor of Britain and extended Roman rule north to the Firth of Forth (37-93)

Palabra: agrippa
Definiciones: Roman general who commanded the fleet that defeated the forces of Antony and Cleopatra at Actium (63-12 BC)

Palabra: agrippina
Definiciones: granddaughter of Augustus and mother of Caligula and Agrippina the Younger (14 BC - AD 33)
wife who poisoned Claudius after her son Nero was declared heir and who was then put to death by Nero

Palabra: ahab
Definiciones: according to the Old Testament he was a pagan king of Israel and husband of Jezebel (9th century BC)

Palabra: ahriman
Definiciones: the spirit of evil in Zoroastrianism arch rival of Ormazd

Palabra: aiken
Definiciones: United States writer (1889-1973)

Palabra: airedale
Definiciones: breed of large wiry-coated terrier bred in Yorkshire

Palabra: ajax
Definiciones: a mythical Greek hero a warrior who fought against Troy in the Iliad

Palabra: akron
Definiciones: a city in northeastern Ohio the heart of the United States rubber industry

Palabra: al
Definiciones: a silvery ductile metallic element found primarily in bauxite
a state in the southeastern United States on the Gulf of Mexico one of the Confederate states during the American Civil War

Palabra: ala
Definiciones: a flat wing-shaped process or winglike part of an organism "the alae of the nose" "the alae of a maple seed" "the flat petals of a pea blossom are alae"
a wing of an insect

Palabra: alabama
Definiciones: a river in Alabama formed by the confluence of the Coosa and Tallapoosa Rivers near Montgomery flows southwestward to become a tributary of the Mobile River
the Muskhogean language of the Alabama
a member of the Muskhogean people formerly living in what is now the state of Alabama "the Alabamas were members of the Creek Confederacy"
a state in the southeastern United States on the Gulf of Mexico one of the Confederate states during the American Civil War

Definiciones: a native or resident of Alabama

Definiciones: a native or resident of Alabama

Palabra: aladdin
Definiciones: in the Arabian Nights a boy who acquires a magic lamp from which he can summon a genie

Palabra: alamo
Definiciones: a siege and massacre at a mission in San Antonio in 1836 Mexican forces under Santa Anna besieged and massacred American rebels who were fighting to make Texas independent of Mexico

Palabra: alar
Definiciones: a chemical sprayed on fruit trees to regulate their growth so the entire crop can be harvested at one time

Palabra: alaric
Definiciones: king of the Visigoths who captured Rome in 410 (370-410)

Definiciones: a native or resident of Alaska

Definiciones: archaic name for England or Great Britain used poetically

Definiciones: ancient Athenian statesman and general in the Peloponnesian War (circa 450-404 BC)

Palabra: aleutian

Palabra: algol
Definiciones: (from a combination of ALGOrithmic and Language) a programming language used to express computer programs as algorithms
the second brightest star in Perseus the first known eclipsing binary

Palabra: algonquian
Definiciones: family of North American Indian languages spoken from Labrador to South Carolina and west to the Great Plains
a member of any of the North American Indian groups speaking an Algonquian language and originally living in the subarctic regions of eastern Canada many Algonquian tribes migrated south into the woodlands from the Mississippi River to the Atlantic coast

Definiciones: Muslim name for the one and only God

Definiciones: a river that rises in Pennsylvania and flows north into New York and then back south through Pennsylvania again to join the Monongahela River at Pittsburgh which is the beginning of the Ohio River

Palabra: althea
Definiciones: any of various plants of the genus Althaea similar to but having smaller flowers than genus Alcea

Palabra: alzheimer's
Definiciones: a progressive form of presenile dementia that is similar to senile dementia except that it usually starts in the 40s or 50s first symptoms are impaired memory which is followed by impaired thought and speech and finally complete helplessness

Definiciones: modulation of the amplitude of the (radio) carrier wave

Definiciones: a major South American river arises in the Andes and flows eastward into the South Atlantic the world's 2nd longest river (4000 miles)

a large strong and aggressive woman

an enveloping structure or covering enclosing an animal or plant organ or part
the quantity contained in a case
the housing or outer covering of something "the clock has a walnut case"
a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy "the family brought suit against the landlord"
(printing) the receptacle in which a compositor has his type, which is divided into compartments for the different letters, spaces, or numbers "for English, a compositor will ordinarily have two such cases, the upper case containing the capitals and the lower case containing the small letters"
an occurrence of something "it was a case of bad judgment" "another instance occurred yesterday" "but there is always the famous example of the Smiths"
nouns or pronouns or adjectives (often marked by inflection) related in some way to other words in a sentence
a person who is subjected to experimental or other observational procedures someone who is an object of investigation "the subjects for this investigation were selected randomly" "the cases that we studied were drawn from two different communities"

Palabra: edward
Definiciones: King of England from 1901 to 1910 son of Victoria and Prince Albert famous for his elegant sporting ways (1841-1910)
son of Edward III who defeated the French at Crecy and Poitiers in the Hundred Years' War (1330-1376)
third son of Elizabeth II (born in 1964)
King of England from 1272 to 1307 conquered Wales (1239-1307)
King of England from 1307 to 1327 and son of Edward I was defeated at Bannockburn by the Scots led by Robert the Bruce was deposed and died in prison (1284-1327)
son of Edward II and King of England from 1327-1377 his claim to the French throne provoked the Hundred Years' War his reign was marked by an epidemic of the Black Plague and by the emergence of the House of Commons as the powerful arm of British Parliament (1312-1377)
King of England from 1461 to 1470 and from 1471 to 1483 was dethroned in 1470 but regained the throne in 1471 by his victory at the battle of Tewkesbury (1442-1483)
King of England who was crowned at the age of 13 on the death of his father Edward IV but was immediately confined to the Tower of London where he and his younger brother were murdered (1470-1483)
King of England and Ireland from 1547 to 1553 son of Henry VIII and Jane Seymour died of tuberculosis (1537-1553)
King of England and Ireland in 1936 his marriage to Wallis Warfield Simpson created a constitutional crisis leading to his abdication (1894-1972)

a native or inhabitant of Hindustan or India

Palabra: hinduism
Definiciones: the religion of most people in India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and Nepal
a body of religious and philosophical beliefs and cultural practices native to India and based on a caste system it is characterized by a belief in reincarnation, by a belief in a supreme being of many forms and natures, by the view that opposing theories are aspects of one eternal truth, and by a desire for liberation from earthly evils

Palabra: hindustan
Definiciones: northern region of India where Hinduism predominates

Palabra: hindustani
Definiciones: a form of Hindi spoken around Delhi
a native or inhabitant of Hindustan or India

Palabra: hipparchus
Definiciones: Greek astronomer and mathematician who discovered the precession of the equinoxes and made the first known star chart and is said to have invented trigonometry (second century BC)

Palabra: hippocrates
Definiciones: medical practitioner who is regarded as the father of medicine author of the Hippocratic oath (circa 460-377 BC)

Palabra: hirohito
Definiciones: emperor of Japan who renounced his divinity and became a constitutional monarch after Japan surrendered at the end of World War II (1901-1989)

Palabra: hiroshima
Definiciones: a port city on the southwestern coast of Honshu in Japan on August 6, 1945 Hiroshima was almost completely destroyed by the first atomic bomb dropped on a populated area

Palabra: hispanic
Definiciones: an American whose first language is Spanish

Palabra: hispaniola
Definiciones: an island in the West Indies

Palabra: hiss
Definiciones: a cry or noise made to express displeasure or contempt
a fricative sound (especially as an expression of disapproval) "the performers could not be heard over the hissing of the audience"

Palabra: hitchcock
Definiciones: English film director noted for his skill in creating suspense (1899-1980)

Palabra: hitler
Definiciones: German Nazi dictator during World War II (1889-1945)

Palabra: hittite
Definiciones: the language of the Hittites and the principal language of the Anatolian group of languages deciphered from cuneiform inscriptions
a member of an ancient people who inhabited Anatolia and northern Syria about 2000 to 1200 BC

Palabra: hmong
Definiciones: a language of uncertain affiliation spoken by the Hmong
a people living traditionally in mountain villages in southern China and adjacent areas of Vietnam and Laos and Thailand many have emigrated to the United States

Palabra: ho
Definiciones: a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group occurs together with yttrium forms highly magnetic compounds

Palabra: hobart
Definiciones: a port and state capital of Tasmania

Palabra: hobbes
Definiciones: English materialist and political philosopher who advocated absolute sovereignty as the only kind of government that could resolve problems caused by the selfishness of human beings (1588-1679)

Palabra: hobbs
Definiciones: notable English cricketer (1882-1963)

Palabra: hodgkin
Definiciones: English physiologist who, with Andrew Huxley, discovered the role of potassium and sodium atoms in the transmission of the nerve impulse (1914-1998)
English chemist (born in Egypt) who used crystallography to study the structure of organic compounds (1910-1994)
English physician who first described Hodgkin's disease (1798-1866)

Palabra: hoffa
Definiciones: United States labor leader who was president of the Teamsters Union he was jailed for trying to bribe a judge and later disappeared and is assumed to have been murdered (1913-1975)

Definiciones: versatile United States film actor (born in 1937)

Definiciones: a German noble family that ruled Brandenburg and Prussia

(thermodynamics) a thermodynamic quantity representing the amount of energy in a system that is no longer available for doing mechanical work "entropy increases as matter and energy in the universe degrade to an ultimate state of inert uniformity"
1/60 of a minute the basic unit of time adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites

Palabra: set
Definiciones: several exercises intended to be done in series "he did four sets of the incline bench press"
an unofficial association of people or groups "the smart set goes there" "they were an angry lot"
(psychology) being temporarily ready to respond in a particular way "the subjects' set led them to solve problems the familiar way and to overlook the simpler solution" "his instructions deliberately gave them the wrong set"
(mathematics) an abstract collection of numbers or symbols "the set of prime numbers is infinite"
a group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used "a set of books" "a set of golf clubs" "a set of teeth"
the descent of a heavenly body below the horizon "before the set of sun"
any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals "the early sets ran on storage batteries"
a unit of play in tennis or squash "they played two sets of tennis after dinner"
the act of putting something in position "he gave a final set to his hat"
a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way "the set of his mind was obvious"
the process of becoming hard or solid by cooling or drying or crystallization "the hardening of concrete" "he tested the set of the glue"
representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production "the sets were meticulously authentic"
evil Egyptian god with the head of a beast that has high square ears and a long snout brother and murderer of Osiris

Definiciones: a presocratic Greek philosopher and astronomer (who predicted an eclipse in 585 BC) who was said by Aristotle to be the founder of physical science he held that all things originated in water (624-546 BC)

Definiciones: (Greek mythology) one of the three Graces

Palabra: thea
Definiciones: (Greek mythology) the Titaness who was mother of Helios and Selene and Eos in ancient mythology

Palabra: thebes
Definiciones: an ancient Egyptian city on the Nile River that flourished from the 22nd century BC to the 18th century BC today the archeological remains include many splendid temples and tombs

Palabra: themistocles
Definiciones: Athenian statesman who persuaded Athens to build a navy and then led it to victory over the Persians (527-460 BC)

Palabra: theodosius
Definiciones: the last emperor of a united Roman Empire, he took control of the eastern empire and ended the war with the Visigoths he became a Christian and in 391 banned all forms of pagan worship (346-395)

Palabra: theosophy
Definiciones: a system of belief based on mystical insight into the nature of God and the soul

Palabra: theravada
Definiciones: one of two great schools of Buddhist doctrine emphasizing personal salvation through your own efforts a conservative form of Buddhism that adheres to Pali scriptures and the non-theistic ideal of self purification to nirvana the dominant religion of Sri Lanka (Ceylon) and Myanmar (Burma) and Thailand and Laos and Cambodia

Palabra: theresa
Definiciones: Indian nun and missionary in the Roman Catholic Church (born of Albanian parents in what is now Macedonia) dedicated to helping the poor in India (1910-1997)

Palabra: thermopylae
Definiciones: a famous battle in 480 BC a Greek army under Leonidas was annihilated by the Persians who were trying to conquer Greece

Palabra: thermos
Definiciones: vacuum flask that preserves temperature of hot or cold drinks

Palabra: theseus
Definiciones: (Greek mythology) a hero and king of Athens who was noted for his many great deeds: killed Procrustes and the Minotaur and defeated the Amazons and united Attica

Palabra: zephaniah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zephaniah which are concerned mainly with the approaching judgment by God upon the sinners of Judah
a Hebrew minor prophet of the late 7th century BC

Palabra: zeppelin
Definiciones: German inventor who designed and built the first rigid motorized dirigible (1838-1917)
a large rigid dirigible designed to carry passengers or bombs

Palabra: zest
Definiciones: a tart spicy quality
vigorous and enthusiastic enjoyment

Definiciones: type genus of the family Zeidae
(Greek mythology) the supreme god of ancient Greek mythology son of Rhea and Cronus whom he dethroned husband and brother of Hera brother of Poseidon and Hades father of many gods counterpart of Roman Jupiter

Definiciones: Soviet general who during World Warr II directed the counteroffensive at Stalingrad and relieved Leningrad and captured Berlin (1896-1974)

Definiciones: German chemist honored for his research on polymers (1898-1973)

Definiciones: a landlocked republic in south central Africa formerly called Rhodesia achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1980

Definiciones: a native or inhabitant of Zimbabwe

Definiciones: dry fruity red wine from California

Palabra: zion
Definiciones: originally a stronghold captured by David (the 2nd king of the Israelites) above it was built a temple and later the name extended to the whole hill finally it became a synonym for the city of Jerusalem "the inhabitants of Jerusalem are personified as `the daughter of Zion'"

Definiciones: a policy for establishing and developing a national homeland for Jews in Palestine
a movement of world Jewry that arose late in the 19th century with the aim of creating a Jewish state in Palestine

Palabra: zionist
Definiciones: a Jewish supporter of Zionism

Palabra: zn
Definiciones: a bluish-white lustrous metallic element brittle at ordinary temperatures but malleable when heated used in a wide variety of alloys and in galvanizing iron it occurs naturally as zinc sulphide in zinc blende

Definiciones: French novelist and critic defender of Dreyfus (1840-1902)

Definiciones: a selective-serotonin reuptake inhibitor commonly prescribed as an antidepressant (trade name Zoloft)

Palabra: zomba
Definiciones: a city in southern Malawi was the capital until 1971

Palabra: zoroaster
Definiciones: Persian prophet who founded Zoroastrianism (circa 628-551 BC)

Palabra: zoroastrian
Definiciones: follower of Zoroaster and Zoroastrianism

Palabra: zoroastrianism
Definiciones: system of religion founded in Persia in the 6th century BC by Zoroaster set forth in the Zend-Avesta based on concept of struggle between light (good) and dark (evil)

Palabra: zr
Definiciones: a lustrous grey strong metallic element resembling titanium it is used in nuclear reactors as a neutron absorber it occurs in baddeleyite but is obtained chiefly from zircon

Definiciones: German chemist (born in Austria) honored for his research on colloidal solutions (1865-1929)

Definiciones: a member of the Pueblo people living in western New Mexico

Palabra: zwingli
Definiciones: Swiss theologian whose sermons began the Reformation in Switzerland (1484-1531)

Definiciones: United States physicist who invented the iconoscope (1889-1982)

Palabra: a
Definiciones: the 1st letter of the Roman alphabet
(biochemistry) purine base found in DNA and RNA pairs with thymine in DNA and with uracil in RNA
the basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites "a typical household circuit carries 15 to 50 amps"
a metric unit of length equal to one ten billionth of a meter (or 0.0001 micron) used to specify wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation
any of several fat-soluble vitamins essential for normal vision prevents night blindness or inflammation or dryness of the eyes
one of the four nucleotides used in building DNA all four nucleotides have a common phosphate group and a sugar (ribose)
the blood group whose red cells carry the A antigen

Definiciones: a portable container for carrying several objects "the musicians left their instrument cases backstage"
the actual state of things "that was not the case"

an enveloping structure or covering enclosing an animal or plant organ or part
the quantity contained in a case
the housing or outer covering of something "the clock has a walnut case"
a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy "the family brought suit against the landlord"
(printing) the receptacle in which a compositor has his type, which is divided into compartments for the different letters, spaces, or numbers "for English, a compositor will ordinarily have two such cases, the upper case containing the capitals and the lower case containing the small letters"
an occurrence of something "it was a case of bad judgment" "another instance occurred yesterday" "but there is always the famous example of the Smiths"
nouns or pronouns or adjectives (often marked by inflection) related in some way to other words in a sentence
a person who is subjected to experimental or other observational procedures someone who is an object of investigation "the subjects for this investigation were selected randomly" "the cases that we studied were drawn from two different communities"

//SUBDICCIONARIO CON PALABRA CLAVE OLD: 
/////////////////////////////
Palabra: aaron
Definiciones: (Old Testament) elder brother of Moses and first high priest of the Israelites created the golden calf

Palabra: abel
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Cain and Abel were the first children of Adam and Eve born after the Fall of Man Abel was killed by Cain

Palabra: abraham
Definiciones: the first of the Old Testament patriarchs and the father of Isaac according to Genesis, God promised to give Abraham's family (the Hebrews) the land of Canaan (the Promised Land) God tested Abraham by asking him to sacrifice his son "Judaism, Christianity, and Islam each has a special claim on Abraham"

Palabra: adam
Definiciones: (Old Testament) in Judeo-Christian mythology the first man and the husband of Eve and the progenitor of the human race

Palabra: ahab
Definiciones: according to the Old Testament he was a pagan king of Israel and husband of Jezebel (9th century BC)

Palabra: amos
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Amos's prophecies

Palabra: apocrypha
Definiciones: 14 books of the Old Testament included in the Vulgate (except for II Esdras) but omitted in Jewish and Protestant versions of the Bible eastern Christian churches (except the Coptic Church) accept all these books as canonical the Russian Orthodox Church accepts these texts as divinely inspired but does not grant them the same status

Palabra: basil
Definiciones: any of several Old World tropical aromatic annual or perennial herbs of the genus Ocimum

Palabra: bathsheba
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the wife of Uriah and later the wife of king David Solomon was her son by David (circa 10th century BC)

Palabra: belshazzar
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Babylonian general and son of Nebuchadnezzar II according to the Old Testament he was warned of his doom by divine handwriting on the wall that was interpreted by Daniel (6th century BC)

Palabra: benjamin
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the youngest and best-loved son of Jacob and Rachel and one of the twelve forebears of the tribes of Israel

Palabra: beowulf
Definiciones: the legendary hero of an anonymous Old English epic poem composed in the early 8th century he slays a monster and becomes king but dies fighting a dragon

Palabra: buffalo
Definiciones: any of several Old World animals resembling oxen including, e.g., water buffalo Cape buffalo

Palabra: cain
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Cain and Abel were the first children of Adam and Eve born after the Fall of Man Cain killed Abel out of jealousy and was exiled by God

Palabra: christianity
Definiciones: a monotheistic system of beliefs and practices based on the Old Testament and the teachings of Jesus as embodied in the New Testament and emphasizing the role of Jesus as savior

Palabra: daniel
Definiciones: an Old Testament book that tells of the apocalyptic visions and the experiences of Daniel in the court of Nebuchadnezzar
(Old Testament) a youth who was taken into the court of Nebuchadnezzar and given divine protection when thrown into a den of lions (6th century BC)

Palabra: david
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the 2nd king of the Israelites as a young shepherd he fought Goliath (a giant Philistine warrior) and killed him by hitting him in the head with a stone flung from a sling he united Israel with Jerusalem as its capital many of the Psalms are attributed to David (circa 1000-962 BC)

Palabra: delilah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the Philistine mistress of Samson who betrayed him by cutting off his hair and so deprived him of his strength

Palabra: deuteronomy
Definiciones: the fifth book of the Old Testament contains a second statement of Mosaic law

Palabra: ecclesiastes
Definiciones: an Old Testament book consisting of reflections on the vanity of human life is traditionally attributed to Solomon but probably was written about 250 BC

Palabra: edda
Definiciones: either of two distinct works in Old Icelandic dating from the late 13th century and consisting of 34 mythological and heroic ballads composed between 800 and 1200 the primary source for Scandinavian mythology

Palabra: egypt
Definiciones: an ancient empire to the west of Israel centered on the Nile River and ruled by a Pharaoh figured in many events described in the Old Testament

Palabra: elijah
Definiciones: a Hebrew prophet in the Old Testament who opposed the worship of idols he was persecuted for rebuking Ahab and Jezebel (king and queen of Israel) he was taken up to heaven in a chariot of fire (circa 9th century BC)

Palabra: esau
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the eldest son of Isaac who would have inherited the covenant that God made with Abraham and that Abraham passed on to Isaac he traded his birthright to his twin brother Jacob for a mess of pottage

Palabra: esther
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling of a beautiful Jewess who became queen of Persia and saved her people from massacre
(Old Testament) a beautiful Jewess chosen by the king of Persia to be his queen she stopped a plot to massacre all the Jews in Persia (an event celebrated by Jews as the feast of Purim)

Palabra: eve
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Adam's wife in Judeo-Christian mythology: the first woman and mother of the human race God created Eve from Adam's rib and placed Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden

Palabra: exodus
Definiciones: the second book of the Old Testament: tells of the departure of the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt led by Moses God gave them the Ten Commandments and the rest of Mosaic law on Mount Sinai during the Exodus

Palabra: ezekiel
Definiciones: an Old Testament book containing Ezekiel's prophecies of the downfall of Jerusalem and Judah and their subsequent restoration

Palabra: ezra
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling of a rabbi's efforts in the 5th century BC to reconstitute Jewish law and worship in Jerusalem after the Babylonian Captivity

Palabra: genesis
Definiciones: the first book of the Old Testament: tells of Creation Adam and Eve the Fall of Man Cain and Abel Noah and the flood God's covenant with Abraham Abraham and Isaac Jacob and Esau Joseph and his brothers

Palabra: genet
Definiciones: agile Old World viverrine having a spotted coat and long ringed tail

Palabra: goliath
Definiciones: (Old Testament) a giant Philistine warrior who was slain by David with a slingshot

Palabra: gomorrah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) an ancient city near the Dead Sea that (along with Sodom) was destroyed by God for the vice and depravity of its inhabitants

Palabra: gopher
Definiciones: any of various terrestrial burrowing rodents of Old and New Worlds often destroy crops

Palabra: habakkuk
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Habakkuk's prophecies

Palabra: haggai
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Haggai which are concerned mainly with rebuilding the temples after the Babylonian Captivity

Palabra: ham
Definiciones: (Old Testament) son of Noah

Palabra: haman
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the minister of the Persian emperor who hated the Jews and was hanged for plotting to massacre them

Palabra: heather
Definiciones: common Old World heath represented by many varieties low evergreen grown widely in the northern hemisphere

Palabra: hezekiah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) king of Judah who abolished idolatry (715-687 BC)

Palabra: hosea
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Hosea's prophecies

Palabra: isaac
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the second patriarch son of Abraham and Sarah who was offered by Abraham as a sacrifice to God father of Jacob and Esau

Palabra: isaiah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book consisting of Isaiah's prophecies
(Old Testament) the first of the major Hebrew prophets (8th century BC)

Palabra: ishmael
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the son of Abraham who was cast out after the birth of Isaac considered the forebear of 12 Arabian tribes

Palabra: issachar
Definiciones: (Old Testament) a son of Jacob and a forebear of one of the tribes of Israel

Palabra: ivy
Definiciones: Old World vine with lobed evergreen leaves and black berrylike fruits

Palabra: jacob
Definiciones: (Old Testament) son of Isaac brother of Esau father of the twelve patriarchs of Israel Jacob wrestled with God and forced God to bless him, so God gave Jacob the new name of Israel (meaning `one who has been strong against God')

Palabra: jehovah
Definiciones: a name for the God of the Old Testament as transliterated from the Hebrew consonants YHVH

Palabra: jeremiah
Definiciones: a book in the Old Testament containing the oracles of the prophet Jeremiah
(Old Testament) an Israelite prophet who is remembered for his angry lamentations (jeremiads) about the wickedness of his people (circa 626-587 BC)

Palabra: jericho
Definiciones: a village in Palestine near the north end of the Dead Sea in the Old Testament it was the first place taken by the Israelites under Joshua as they entered the Promised Land

Palabra: jeroboam
Definiciones: (Old Testament) first king of the northern kingdom of Israel who led Israel into sin (10th century BC)

Palabra: jezebel
Definiciones: wife of Ahab who was king of Israel according to the Old Testament she was a cruel immoral queen who fostered the worship of Baal and tried to kill Elijah and other prophets of Israel (9th century BC)

Palabra: job
Definiciones: a book in the Old Testament containing Job's pleas to God about his afflictions and God's reply
a Jewish hero in the Old Testament who maintained his faith in God in spite of afflictions that tested him

Palabra: joel
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Joel's prophecies

Palabra: jonah
Definiciones: a book in the Old Testament that tells the story of Jonah and the whale
(Old Testament) Jonah did not wish to become a prophet so God caused a great storm to throw him overboard from a ship he was saved by being swallowed by a whale that vomited him out onto dry land

Palabra: joseph
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the 11th son of Jacob and one of the 12 patriarchs of Israel Jacob gave Joseph a coat of many colors, which made his brothers jealous and they sold him into slavery in Egypt

Palabra: joshua
Definiciones: a book in the Old Testament describing how Joshua led the Israelites into Canaan (the Promised Land) after the death of Moses
(Old Testament) Moses' successor who led the Israelites into the Promised Land best remembered for his destruction of Jericho

Palabra: josue
Definiciones: a book in the Old Testament describing how Joshua led the Israelites into Canaan (the Promised Land) after the death of Moses

Palabra: judah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the fourth son of Jacob who was forebear of one of the tribes of Israel one of his descendants was to be the Messiah

Palabra: kali
Definiciones: bushy plant of Old World salt marshes and sea beaches having prickly leaves burned to produce a crude soda ash

Palabra: leviathan
Definiciones: monstrous sea creature symbolizing evil in the Old Testament

Palabra: leviticus
Definiciones: the third book of the Old Testament contains Levitical law and ritual precedents

Palabra: lot
Definiciones: (Old Testament) nephew of Abraham God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah but chose to spare Lot and his family who were told to flee without looking back at the destruction

Palabra: malachi
Definiciones: an Old Testament book containing the prophecies of Malachi

Palabra: mavis
Definiciones: common Old World thrush noted for its song

Palabra: melissa
Definiciones: a genus of Old World mints of the family Labiatae

Palabra: methuselah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) a patriarch (grandfather of Noah) who is said to have lived 969 years

Palabra: micah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Micah foretelling the destruction of Jerusalem

Palabra: michael
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the guardian archangel of the Jews

Palabra: moses
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the Hebrew prophet who led the Israelites from Egypt across the Red sea on a journey known as the Exodus Moses received the Ten Commandments from God on Mount Sinai

Palabra: nahum
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Nahum's prophecy of the fall of Nineveh

Palabra: naomi
Definiciones: the mother-in-law of Ruth whose story is told in the Book of Ruth in the Old Testament

Palabra: nebuchadnezzar
Definiciones: (Old Testament) king of Chaldea who captured and destroyed Jerusalem and exiled the Israelites to Babylonia (630?-562 BC)

Palabra: nehemiah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling how a Jewish official at the court of Artaxerxes I in 444 BC became a leader in rebuilding Jerusalem after the Babylonian Captivity

Palabra: nimrod
Definiciones: (Old Testament) a famous hunter

Palabra: noemi
Definiciones: the mother-in-law of Ruth whose story is told in the Book of Ruth in the Old Testament

Palabra: numbers
Definiciones: the fourth book of the Old Testament contains a record of the number of Israelites who followed Moses out of Egypt

Palabra: obadiah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling Obadiah's prophecies the shortest book in the Christian Bible

Palabra: page
Definiciones: United States diplomat and writer about the Old South (1853-1922)

Palabra: proverbs
Definiciones: an Old Testament book consisting of proverbs from various Israeli sages (including Solomon)

Palabra: psalms
Definiciones: an Old Testament book consisting of a collection of 150 Psalms

Palabra: python
Definiciones: large Old World boas

Palabra: rachel
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the second wife of Jacob and mother of Joseph and Benjamin

Palabra: rebecca
Definiciones: (Old Testament) wife of Isaac and mother of Jacob and Esau

Palabra: rebekah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) wife of Isaac and mother of Jacob and Esau

Palabra: reuben
Definiciones: (Old Testment) a son of Jacob and forefather of one of the tribes of Israel

Palabra: robin
Definiciones: small Old World songbird with a reddish breast

Palabra: ruth
Definiciones: a book of the Old Testament that tells the story of Ruth who was not an Israelite but who married an Israelite and who stayed with her mother-in-law Naomi after her husband died
the great-grandmother of king David whose story is told in the Book of Ruth in the Old Testament

Palabra: samson
Definiciones: (Old Testament) a judge of Israel who performed herculean feats of strength against the Philistines until he was betrayed to them by his mistress Delilah

Palabra: samuel
Definiciones: (Old Testament) Hebrew prophet and judge who anointed Saul as king

Palabra: sarah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the wife of Abraham and mother of Isaac

Palabra: saul
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the first king of the Israelites who defended Israel against many enemies (especially the Philistines)

Palabra: septuagint
Definiciones: the oldest Greek version of the Old Testament said to have been translated from the Hebrew by Jewish scholars at the request of Ptolemy II

Palabra: seth
Definiciones: (Old Testament) third son of Adam and Eve given by God in place of the murdered Abel

Palabra: sodom
Definiciones: (Old Testament) an ancient city near the Dead Sea that (along with Gomorrah) was destroyed by God for the wickedness of its inhabitants

Palabra: solomon
Definiciones: (Old Testament) son of David and king of Israel noted for his wisdom (10th century BC)

Palabra: uriah
Definiciones: (Old Testament) the husband of Bathsheba and a soldier who was sent to die in battle so that king David could marry his wife (circa 10th century BC)

Palabra: yahweh
Definiciones: a name for the God of the Old Testament as transliterated from the Hebrew consonants YHVH

Palabra: zechariah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zechariah which are concerned mainly with the renewal of Israel after the Babylonian Captivity

Palabra: zephaniah
Definiciones: an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zephaniah which are concerned mainly with the approaching judgment by God upon the sinners of Judah
